wikipedia_page.main: Sona Jobarteh (born 1983) is a multi-instrumentalist and composer from the Gambia. She is from one of the five principal kora-playing griot families of West Africa, and is the first female professional kora player to come from a griot family. She is the cousin of the celebrated kora player Toumani Diabate, and is the sister of the diaspora kora player Tunde Jegede.

response: File:Aid for Trade Global Review 2017 – Day 1 Sona Jobarteh tuning kora.jpg|Sona Jobarteh tuning a 21-string kora with open machine head tuners, 2017.
* Sona Jobarteh (Gambia/United Kingdom, female kora player)
* Sona Jobarteh, first female kora artist (musician)

Diabaté comes from a long family tradition of kora players, including his father Sidiki Diabaté, who recorded the first ever kora album in 1970. His family's oral tradition tells of 70 generations of musicians preceding him in a patrilineal line. His cousin Sona Jobarteh is the first female kora player to come from a Griot family. His younger brother Mamadou Sidiki Diabaté is also a prominent kora player.
File:Aid for Trade Global Review 2017 – Day 1 Sona Jobarteh tuning kora.jpg|Sona Jobarteh tuning a kora with open machine heads

Sidiki Diabaté is a Malian kora player, musician and music producer born in 1992 in Bamako, Mali. He is the son of renowned kora player Toumani Diabaté and grandson of Sidiki Diabaté. Diabaté belongs to the 77th generation of musicians in a long family tradition of griots, his family being primarily kora players. His grandfather Sidiki Diabaté recorded the first ever kora album in 1970. His father's cousin Sona Jobarteh is the first female kora player to come from a Griot family. His uncle Mamadou Sidiki Diabaté is also a prominent kora player.
* Sona Jobarteh - Griot kora player, singer and guitarist from Gambia
*Sona Jobarteh, vocalist, multi-instrumentalist, and composer from the Gambia and the UK
